title: 'We have a PROBLEM' UK ambassador to Poland demands Britain take control of immigration
text: 1 of 14 NICK CLEGG He further went on to say the Prime Minister wanted to guarantee everyone the right to stay in the UK, but was waiting for the EU Council to pick up this offer. We have a problem, we have to freeze the income of people Jonathan Knott, UK ambassador in Poland Mr Knott made it clear “it would be unfair” to remove the Polish immigrants, who have helped shape modern Britain. The ambassador is set to meet with member of the Polish community from across Britain in two weeks time to deal with issues of race-based violence. TVN24 Mr Knott said no immigrants will be made to leave, but rather less would be allowed in after Brexit He added: “The facts are, that in the summer we dealt with an increase in hate based crimes.” He did however point out these incidents were not as common anymore, thanks in part to the work of police forces. TVN24 According to the ambassador, Brexit was clear message from the British people Mr Knott also revealed plans for the "Belvedere Forum", a future economic initiative aimed at connecting Britain and Poland. He said: "Great Britain is the second biggest export market for Poland and we must keep it that way." Related articles
